intro: Calobota lotononoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and indirect sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant, although it is less common in the wild compared to other members of its family.
